intro: Linaria monomotapensis, commonly known as the Cape goldflag, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Scrophulariaceae family and is characterized by its bright yellow, tubular flowers that bloom in spring. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. It has slender, branching stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. Linaria monomotapensis is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens due to its vibrant color and compact growth habit.
